She is the host of Sunrise Daily at Channels TV. ==Education== Maupe is a graduate from University of Lagos where she had her B.A in English. She later proceeded to her Masters in International Relations and Development Studies at the University of East Anglia in Norwich. ==Career== Maupe is the co-host of a morning show, Sunrise Daily at Channels TV. She joined Channels TV in 2009. She was summoned to court alongside the manager of Channels TV in 2018 for allegedly giving a platform for some prejudicial comments about the issue between Olisa Metuh and the Federal Government. She also hosted a live controversy that happened between Jimoh Moshood, Chief Superintendent of Police, and Terver Akase, Chief Press Secretary to Benue State governor. The show had to be taken off air due to the heated argument between the duo. ==Award== She got profession achievements award from British Council UK Education Alumni Award in 2016. She also got Outstanding Television Broadcaster award from Nigerian Institute of Public Relations in 2019. She was also named among the best 100 by Sun Newspapers Women Leadership Award. == Personal life == She married Bamidele Mohammed Yussuf on December 28, 2017.
